result.execSummary:
The defendant Felix Deonte Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Felix Deonte Willis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Felix Deonte Willis was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Any bail on deposit to apply.

**06-03-16/JOC amended to reflect that defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: consecutive, credit for 14 DAYS time served.

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm, body armor, or ammunition possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Provide DNA Sample.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felix Deonte Willis

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to state that the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for eligibility for early release programs.
Original Transcript (15 pages) SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT commencing AUGUST 14, 2015 received and filed.
Bail Refund Packets
08/19/15 Bail refund notice/affidavit sent to surety.

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 32 MONTHS, consecutive, credit for 14 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 16 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 16 MONTHS.
 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Any bail on deposit to apply.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm, body armor, or ammunition possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit.

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered counts 1 and 3 Dismissed. 

AS T COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to branch 38 for Sentencing.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report (in file 15CF691).
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-11-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 4.

Court reviews JusticePoint report with the parties and advises defendant to continue compliance with all bail conditions.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated June 29, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addressed the Justice Point Violation Report, that on 6-11-2015, that defendant was subject to a random drug test, which yielded a positive drug test for opiates.  Defense submitted three separate documents from Columbia St. Mary's, which do not document use for opiates.  Court does not take action, but warned defendant, that a further violation may result in a change in his bail.  Upon a global resolution ONLY, the Court would agree to accept case 2014CF5226 from Branch 3.   Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-30-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addressed the Violation Report from Justice Point, that on 6-11-2015, the defendant was subject to a random drug test, which yielded a positive drug test for opiates.  Defense counsel will follow-up with physician to obtain a proof of prescription for defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-17-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including following the rules of Supervision with Justice Point and Absolute Sobriety.   mld

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
-- On 6-11-2015, defendant reported to Justice Point for a scheduled office contact.  During that time defendant was subject to a random drug test, which yielded a positive result for the use of a controlled substance.   
-
Defendant proceeded to vacate the building, before the Court could review this violation.   mld

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  To allow defense to discuss global offer with defendant, and possible transfer of controlled substance case to this court, case adjourned for a further Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-30-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.  mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

from Justice Point, received and filed.  
On 5-11-2015, the defendant was taken into custody, pending new summary charges for bail jumping.  Should defendant remain in custody as of 6-8-2015, he will be discharged from pretrial supervision.   mld

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with Andrew Rider.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rider was previously allowed to withdraw as counsel.  Attorney Dennis Coffey appeared as new defense counsel.  Prior counsel will turn over all the discovery to new counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Justice Point Report.

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Defendant wants to retain private counsel.  Defendant to retain private counsel by the next court date.  All previous conditions of bail to remain.   Court addresses positive drug test and admonishes defendant.  If Court receives another report about a positive drug test result, Court will modify bail considerably.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel appeared via telephonics.  Court addressed the Violation Report from Justice Point for defendant, dated 4-16-2015, for a positive drug test which yielded a positive result for the use of THC.  Court warned defendant that one further positive drug test will result in the forfeiture of the posted cash bond and going into custody.  Case remains calendared for FInal Pretrial Conference in 4-28-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel   State is requesting higher cash bail on both cases 2015CF691 and 2015CF1196, based on the Report from Justice Point, that the defendant was subjected to a baseline drug test on 3-27-2015, which yielded a positive result for the use of THC.  The State noted that this is the defendant's third open case, per the State.  State's Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  The Court ordered forfeiture of the cash bail in the amount of $500.00 on case 2015CF691 and ordered cash bail in the amount of $3,000.00 on case 2015CF691.  Court retained the cash bail in the amount of $2,500.00 with TOT to Justice Point if released (applies to both cases 2015CF691 and 2015CF1196).  

Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-28-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Bovette T., or BST., no drugs or alcohol in system and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  The available discovery was turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial onference in Branch 4 on 4-13-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including cooperation with Justice Point, the no contact order with Bovette T., no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no firearms, until further order of the Court.   mld

15RM016002  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-26-15
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BOVETTE T.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Felix Deonte Willis in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 04.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
